posts.post_content:
Normally, someone would suggest something like [Conspiracy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conspiracy) to break this in half. Not I. For something as cool as this, I'd run a full four [Graveborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Graveborn Muse).  
  
Also, in commander, this plus two [Gravedigger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravedigger) effects ([Entomber Exarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entomber Exarch), [Cadaver Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cadaver Imp), [Pit Keeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pit Keeper)), a [Deathgreeter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathgreeter) or a [Dross Harvester](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dross Harvester), and commander [Lord of Tresserhorn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Tresserhorn) is an automatic mill win.
posts.html:
Normally, someone would suggest something like Conspiracy to break this in half. Not I. For something as cool as this, I'd run a full four Graveborn Muse.

Also, in commander, this plus two Gravedigger effects (Entomber Exarch, Cadaver Imp, Pit Keeper), a Deathgreeter or a Dross Harvester, and commander Lord of Tresserhorn is an automatic mill win.

Posted By: En_Sigma (9/27/2011 7:10:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The flavor is awesome, sure, and this has lots of combo potential - but it costs *six mana*. That's *insanely* high for any deck seeking to combo off with it in a competitive format like Modern. And most Zombies are less than 6 mana to cast; doing a gatherer search for it, there's only 7 Zombies that cost more!  
  
Yes, it could be used to dump a ton of Zombies on the field at once, but in order to do that you have to have a hand full of them when you land this guy. By turn 6, if you have a full hand of Zombies, you're probably doing it wrong. Or have a ton of card draw in the deck, which doesn't work great with it since this thing wants a deck full of Zombies and basically nothing else......  
  
Hm, maybe a casual deck centered around this, a bit of early mana accel, and [Blue Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blue Sun's Zenith) to refill the hand and get Zombies into it once it lands? Or [Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur). Or [Damia, Sage of Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damia, Sage of Stone).
posts.html:
The flavor is awesome, sure, and this has lots of combo potential - but it costs six mana. That's insanely high for any deck seeking to combo off with it in a competitive format like Modern. And most Zombies are less than 6 mana to cast; doing a gatherer search for it, there's only 7 Zombies that cost more!

Yes, it could be used to dump a ton of Zombies on the field at once, but in order to do that you have to have a hand full of them when you land this guy. By turn 6, if you have a full hand of Zombies, you're probably doing it wrong. Or have a ton of card draw in the deck, which doesn't work great with it since this thing wants a deck full of Zombies and basically nothing else......

Hm, maybe a casual deck centered around this, a bit of early mana accel, and Blue Sun's Zenith to refill the hand and get Zombies into it once it lands? Or Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur. Or Damia, Sage of Stone.
